meanings.definition: The main body or stalk of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The flower grew from the tall stem.
meanings.sent2: The stem of the tree was strong and sturdy.
meanings.sent3: The stem of the plant waved in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The stem of the flower held the delicate petals.
meanings.sent5: The green stem of the plant stood out against the brown soil.

meanings.definition: To stop the flow or growth of something.
meanings.sent1: She tried to stem the tears by smiling.
meanings.sent2: The dam was built to stem the river's flow.
meanings.sent3: He hoped to stem the tide of negativity with his positive attitude.
meanings.sent4: The new policy helped to stem the losses in the company.
meanings.sent5: They worked hard to stem the spread of rumors in the office.

meanings.sent1: His passion for music stemmed from his childhood experiences.
meanings.sent2: The idea stemmed from a conversation they had last week.
meanings.sent3: Her creativity stemmed from her love for nature.
meanings.sent4: The decision to expand the business stemmed from market research.
meanings.sent5: Their friendship stemmed from a shared love of hiking.
